observationLevels.description: Humanoid automaton with a permanent smile carved into its porcelain face. Repeats greeting protocols endlessly.
The construct's greeting protocols contain subliminal compliance commands. Its eyes track all movement within 30 meters.
Former human employees permanently fused with customer service machinery. They remember their names but nothing else.
observationLevels.notes: Some units still receive paychecks to accounts that no longer exist.

observationLevels.description: Flickering humanoid shape composed of corrupted data streams. Phases in and out of visibility.
Remnants of deleted employee records seeking to restore themselves. Can possess electronic systems temporarily.
observationLevels.weakness: Analog equipment is invisible to them
observationLevels.abilities: Data Corruption, Phase Shift, System Possession

observationLevels.description: Each wraith contains fragments of multiple deleted identities, creating a schizophrenic consciousness.
observationLevels.origin: Mass data purge during Project Babel incident
observationLevels.notes: They write their names on walls in binary, desperately trying to remember who they were.

observationLevels.description: Humanoid figures with bark-like skin and branch appendages. Move slowly but with purpose.
Former humans who accepted symbiosis with the forest. Communicate through chemical signals and root networks.
They chose this transformation willingly, seeking immortality through the collective forest consciousness.
observationLevels.notes: They plant seeds in corpses, believing death is just another form of growth.

observationLevels.description: Exists in multiple probable states simultaneously. Appearance shifts based on observer's expectations.
Beings that exist across multiple probability streams. Can manifest the least likely outcome of any action.
Former quantum physicists who observed their own quantum state, becoming permanently uncertain.
observationLevels.notes: They sometimes complete conversations that never started.
